title: re-start
author: re-start
content: What happened:Avalar is a scam investment project that offers unreasonable high profits. Also, instead of a Telegram group (where you can see the opinions of all investors), you can find only one Telegram ID. By looking at the plans of this project, you can understand that this is an unreasonable profit to attract investors: (~4.333% hourly for 24 hours (deposit included), 120% after 1 day, 200% after 7 days). Please pay attention to this part: Quote from: https://avalar.vip/about/ They created a unique robot that generates daily profit and predicts the stages of bitcoin.  It's like a joke. Also, I have found a site with a similar design that has been launched for only a day and is probably going to scam (In that case, I will update this post). https://amr-invest.com/Reference Link:https://avalar.vip/?lng=enTechnical info:Registration date: 12 Aug 2022 (6 days and 6 hours ago)Expiration date:    12 Aug 2023 (in 11 months and 24 days)Hosted by:   Ddos-Guard Ltd.Server location: Russian Federation (185.178.208.180)Payment Method:BitcoinArchive:https://archive.ph/gJyPqQuote More information:Domain: avalar.vipInstant messaging: Telegram (https://t.me/avalarvip)Alexa Rank: 2,623,448Registrant Address: Ledenweg 7, Radebeul, 01067, GermanyRegistrar Abuse Contact Phone: +880.1913949283

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: re-start on August 18, 2022, 01:41:30 PM...you can understand that this is an unreasonable profit to attract investors: (~4.333% hourly for 24 hours (deposit included), 120% after 1 day, 200% after 7 days).I stopped reading when I got here. Anyone with a bit of experience knows that these numbers amount to a scam, although the bad news is that not everyone knows it and some end up falling for it.Any offer of profitability that is too good to be true should raise red flags.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote from: Don Pedro Dinero on August 19, 2022, 06:16:42 AMI stopped reading when I got here. Anyone with a bit of experience knows that these numbers amount to a scam, although the bad news is that not everyone knows it and some end up falling for it.Any offer of profitability that is too good to be true should raise red flags.They tried to imitate legit trading platforms and investment sites, they are good at configuring words to make it appear that they are legit they even posted fake profiles to make the site compelling, their goal is to make themselves look legit in the eyes of newbies, they are not targetting experienced investors they are targeting naive investors who are attracted on design and good configuration of words.Just check this post on their widgetQuoteEXPERTS WILL DO EVERYTHING FOR YOUHighly spent team Avalar It controls all processes of a 24/7 shopping robot. After investing, you will observe the growth of your real incomeThe profit sounds too good to be true but the words are compelling for newbies.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: Don Pedro Dinero on August 19, 2022, 06:16:42 AMQuote from: re-start on August 18, 2022, 01:41:30 PM...you can understand that this is an unreasonable profit to attract investors: (~4.333% hourly for 24 hours (deposit included), 120% after 1 day, 200% after 7 days).I stopped reading when I got here. Anyone with a bit of experience knows that these numbers amount to a scam, although the bad news is that not everyone knows it and some end up falling for it.Any offer of profitability that is too good to be true should raise red flags.Experienced people stay away from such offers. As a result, scammers fail to attract them. But you will find many crypto users who look for such opportunities in hopes of quick profits. The current market conditions are not good which may lead to those new crypto users wanting to step into these traps to recover their losses. In bear markets, the number of such ponzi websites increases, because at this time they get more victims.
